alert.note: Alert for Howell; Oregon; Ozark; Shannon; Texas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 04 at 2:47PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in south central Missouri, Howell, Oregon, Shannon and Texas. In southwest Missouri, Ozark. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 247 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. An inch to inch and a half of rain has already fallen is some locations. - This includes the following low water crossings... Bennetts River at Highway 142, Middle Fork Eleven Point River at County Road 1420, Gill Branch at Highway Y, Bennetts Bayou at Highway 142, Spring River at Highway 142, Howell Creek at County Road 9790 and Eleven Point River at County Road 1550. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Plains, Mountain View, Willow Springs, Birch Tree, Bakersfield, Pomona, South Fork, Koshkonong, Brandsville, Montier, Thomasville, White Church, Peace Valley, Rover, Teresita, Pottersville, Lanton, Moody, Caulfield and Ozark National Scenic Riverways. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
